Interface com.chimu.form.mapping.Slot

public interface Slot
A slot defines a connection point between state information represented in an object and state information stored on a database It provides transformation capabilities in both directions (as needed).

Coming from an object-mapper's point of view, the slots define what state information is needed to save the object to the database and what state information must be retrieved from the database to correctly replicate that database version of the object.

Each slot is responsible for handling the transformations themselves which can either be very simple or quite extensive.

A slot defines how to bind some information from an object to a database A slot is the common ground between the attributes of the database

Mappers and Retrievers are the factories for Slots.

See Also:
ObjectMapper, SelectiveObjectRetriever

Method Index

isValueNullable()
Can this slot have null values
name()
The name of the slot
setupDisableObjectInitializing()
Make the slot not initialize the object
setupDisableRowWriting()
Make the slot not write to the database
setupGenerateForInsertFunction(Function2Arg)
Setup a generator function that will be used when the slot value is to be written for insert into the database.
setupGenerateForUpdateFunction(Function2Arg)
The generator (Function2Arg) will receive the slotValue as the first argument and the object itself as the second argument.
setupGetter(Function1Arg)
setupGetterAndSetter(Function1Arg, Procedure2Arg)
setupOptimisticLock()
Specify that this slot should be used with optimistic locking, using the default slotValue.equals(rowSlotValue) algorithm.
setupOptimisticLockWithPredicate(Predicate2Arg)
Specify that this slot should be used with optimistic locking and that it should use optimisticPredicate {Predicate2Arg[slotValue, rowSlotValue]} to test whether the slot matches the rowSlotValue.
setupRefreshAfterInsert()
Specify that this slot needs to be refreshed after an insert to the database

 public abstract String name()
The name of the slot

 public abstract void setupRefreshAfterInsert()

 public abstract void setupRefreshAfterUpdate()
setupRefreshAfterInsertOrUpdate 
 public abstract void setupRefreshAfterInsertOrUpdate()
setupOptimisticLock 
 public abstract void setupOptimisticLock()
Specify that this slot should be used with optimistic locking, using the default slotValue.equals(rowSlotValue) algorithm.

setupOptimisticLockWithPredicate 
 public abstract void setupOptimisticLockWithPredicate(Predicate2Arg optimisticPredicate)
Specify that this slot should be used with optimistic locking and that it should use optimisticPredicate {Predicate2Arg[slotValue, rowSlotValue]} to test whether the slot matches the rowSlotValue.

Parameters:
optimisticPredicate - returns true if slotValue {arg1} matches rowSlotValue{arg2}.

 public abstract void setupDisableRowWriting()
Make the slot not write to the database

setupSetter 
 public abstract void setupSetter(Procedure2Arg setter)
setupGenerateForInsertFunction 
 public abstract void setupGenerateForInsertFunction(Function2Arg generator)
Setup a generator function that will be used when the slot value is to be written for insert into the database. The generator (Function2Arg) will receive the slotValue as the first argument and the object itself as the second argument. It should return the value to use for the slot when doing a first insert into the database

setupGenerateForUpdateFunction 
 public abstract void setupGenerateForUpdateFunction(Function2Arg generator)
The generator (Function2Arg) will receive the slotValue as the first argument and the object itself as the second argument. It should return the value to use for the slot when doing any updates to the database

isValueNullable 
 public abstract boolean isValueNullable()
Can this slot have null values

valueMaximumLength 
 public abstract int valueMaximumLength()
What is the maximum length a value can be
